description: Arithmetic and geometric means of A046791(n) and a(n) both integers.
comments: n such that A008475(n) is different from A001414(n). - _Benoit Cloitre_, Jan 11 2003This sequence appears to coincide with the sequence of moduli n for which there exist affine maps f:x->a x + b modulo n, with a>1, such that f has order n in the affine group. - Emmanuel Amiot (manu.amiot(AT)free.fr), Jul 28 2007
references: Mohammad K. Azarian, AM - GM Strikes Again, Problem 451, College Mathematics Journal, Vol. 22, No. 3, May 1991, p. 255.  Solution published in Vol. 23, No. 3, May 1992, pp. 248-249.
Mohammad K. Azarian, An Application of the Inequality on the Means, Problem B-635, Fibonacci Quarterly, Vol. 27, No. 1, Feb. 1989, p.87.  Solution published in Vol. 28, No. 1, Feb. 1990, pp. 86-87.
Amiot, E., AutoSimilar Melodies, J. Math. Music 2 (2008), no. 3, 157-180.
example: 8 is in the list because f:x->5x+1 mod 8 is a map with order 8 in the group of affine maps mod 8: the smallest power of f equal to identity is f^8. Obviously the maps x->x+1 always have this property, so are excluded from consideration.
